title: Preterite vs Imperfect
subtitle: Using both past tenses together
objectives: Understand when to use each tense
Combine preterite and imperfect in narratives

screens.heading: The Key Distinction
screens.content: PRETERITE: Completed actions, specific times, sequence of events. IMPERFECT: Background, descriptions, ongoing/habitual actions.
screens.tip: Imperfect sets the scene, preterite advances the action!

examples.english: It was raining (ongoing) when I left (completed)
While I was studying (ongoing), the phone rang (completed)

screens.instruction: Translate: 'I was eating when she called'
